channel.title: Double xp ring
channel.description: Is it any methods we can make a item example: a ring give double xp? I'm using the source hybrid pvp v3, at the moment.

item.title: Double xp ring
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Madness Chaotic-Madness
item.description:
@Chaotic-Madness wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:431224”]All you have to do is

public void addExp(int skill, int exp) { if (getInventory().getRing().getId() == ringId) { exp *= 2; } // normal stuff } [/quote]

What do i import in the playerassistiant.java to make your code work, zyle?

Read full topic

item.title: Double xp ring
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

All you have to do is

public void addExp(int skill, int exp) {
    if (getInventory().getRing().getId() == ringId) {
        exp *= 2;
    }
    // normal stuff
}

Read full topic

item.title: Double xp ring
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Madness Chaotic-Madness
item.description:
@Chaotic-Madness wrote:

[quote=“Berky-Scape, post:11, topic:431224”][code]
if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == RING ID) //double xp ring
{
amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS * 2;
}
else
{
amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS;
}
int oldLevel = getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]);
c.playerXP[skill] += amount;
if (oldLevel < getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]))
{
if (c.playerLevel[skill] < c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]) && skill != 3 && skill != 5)
c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]);

                    levelUp(skill);
                    c.gfx100(199);
                    requestUpdates();
            }
            setSkillLevel(skill, c.playerLevel[skill], c.playerXP[skill]);
            refreshSkill(skill);
            return true;

[/code][/quote]

Still get the 100 errors for missing a bracklet, is it any programs that can see bracklet errors?
I’m so bad with them

Read full topic

item.title: Double xp ring
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

                if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == RING ID) //double xp ring
                { 
                        amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS * 2;
                } 
                else 
                {
                        amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS;
                }
                int oldLevel = getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]);
                c.playerXP[skill] += amount;
                if (oldLevel < getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill])) 
                {
                        if (c.playerLevel[skill] < c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]) && skill != 3 && skill != 5)
                            c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]);

                        levelUp(skill);
                        c.gfx100(199);
                        requestUpdates();
                }
                setSkillLevel(skill, c.playerLevel[skill], c.playerXP[skill]);
                refreshSkill(skill);
                return true;

Read full topic

item.title: Double xp ring
item.dc:creator: @voetbal645 voetbal645
item.description:
@voetbal645 wrote:

look in playerassistant.java for resetbarrows
then above that add this

if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerRing] == RING ID) //double xp ring { amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS * 2; } else { amount *= Config.SERVER_EXP_BONUS; } int oldLevel = getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]); c.playerXP[skill] += amount; if (oldLevel < getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill])) { if (c.playerLevel[skill] < c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]) && skill != 3 && skill != 5) c.playerLevel[skill] = c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill]); levelUp(skill); c.gfx100(199); requestUpdates(); } setSkillLevel(skill, c.playerLevel[skill], c.playerXP[skill]); refreshSkill(skill); return true; }

Read full topic
